issue.title: Unchecking "Enabled on this site" does not disable the annoyances filters for the site
issue.body:
@piejanssens commented on [Tue Jun 07 2022](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardForSafari/issues/718)

<!--  As an open-source project with a dedicated but small maintainer team, it can sometimes take a long time for issues to be addressed so please be patient and we will get back to you as soon as we can.
-->

### Prerequisites

Please answer the following questions for yourself before submitting an issue. **YOU MAY DELETE THE PREREQUISITES SECTION.**

- [X] I am running the latest version
- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed

### Issue Details

<!--- Please include all relevant details about the environment you experienced the bug in -->

* AdGuard for Safari version: 1.11.4
* Environment name and version: Safari 15.5 (17613.2.7.1.8)
* Operating System: macOS 12.4.0
* Filters you use in AdGuard: ads, privacy, annoyances (EasyList Cookie List, I don't care about cookies, AdBlock warning removal list), language-specific (NL)


### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
If I uncheck "Enabled on this site", I expect any AdGuard to no longer affect the site in any way.

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
Some filters are still being applied. I am certain that this is a bug in AdGuard as I can get the wanted effect by disabling the AdGuard all-together via the "Pause AdGuard for Safari" option.

### Screenshots
<!-- If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. -->

<details><summary>Screenshot:</summary>

<!--- drag and drop, upload or paste your screenshot to this area-->

</details>

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context about the problem here. -->

---

@Birbber commented on [Wed Jun 08 2022](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardForSafari/issues/718#issuecomment-1150112013)

@piejanssens Hi! Could you give an example of the webpage so I could check it on my end?

---

@piejanssens commented on [Wed Jun 08 2022](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardForSafari/issues/718#issuecomment-1150120107)

Hi @Birbber,

1. Enable the "I don't care about cookies" annoyance filter.
2. Visit https://www.era.be/nl/te-koop
3. Notice you can't scroll
4. Disable AdGuard on the site
5. Notice you still can't scroll...
7. "Pause AdGuard for Safari"
8. Accept the cookies
9. Notice you can scroll

comment.body: @Alex-302 Isn't my assumption correct to think that if I uncheck "Enable on this site", AdGuard would not be influencing the browsing experience in ANY way and it would behave on that site as if the AdBlock extension is disabled overall?

labels.description: Issues, related to AdGuard Extra extension

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
Включите расширение AdGuard Extra в настройках программы.

---

Пользователям браузерного расширения нужно установить скрипт `AdGuard Extra`. Для этого понадобится браузерное расширение-скриптоприёмник `Tampermonkey`

Ссылка на `AdGuard Extra`
https://userscripts.adtidy.org/beta/adguard-extra/1.0/adguard-extra.user.js

После установки скрипта нужно будет зайти в настройки `Tampermonkey`, включить режим эксперта, переключить режим встраивания на `мгновенный` и перезапустить расширение:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8361299/62641343-07248e00-b94c-11e9-9775-9854a7922889.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8361299/62641299-f7a54500-b94b-11e9-8a83-885d89abbeec.png)

comment.body: Нужно проверить обновление фильтров как [сказано здесь](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/115271#issuecomment-1163017721).

comment.body:
Hi @AdamWr ! 
Thanks for quick reply, but unfortunately it doesn't work.
Let me explain what is the issue.

Player inside uses sha256 hash function in order to get hash of text being used to audio processing.
So some reason, when your plugin is enabled - hash calculation is wrong (please see attached video), and audio can't be played.

It's not always 100% reproducible for all pages, but for some reason it has high rate of reproduction for jpost.com

Information that might help you:
We use `hash.js/lib/hash/sha/256.js` v1.1.7 from https://www.npmjs.com/package/hash.js

We have suspicion, that code from your plugin might override some standard JS code or might intersect with other part of code - that might lead to such results.

Also please note, it's not reproducible for simple text, but for real one as in example provided above.
So far it's unique case for us, since we didn't had anything like that before.

If you need  more detail - please let me know, I'll try to help you.

Thanks! 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oJkUZ8Bv7dw
